title: Requires clerk of court to accept notice of pendency in certain equitable distribution matrimonial actions
summary: Requires the clerk of court to accept a notice of pendency in equitable distribution matrimonial actions.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2265

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the domestic relations law and the civil practice law and
rules, in relation to a notice of pendency in certain matrimonial
cases

SUMMARY:
This bill would amend section 234 of the
Domestic Relations
Law and add a new undesignated paragraph to subdivision (a) of Rule
6501 of the Civil Practice Law and Rules to provide that notices of
pendency in matrimonial actions shall be filed in all instances when
the complaint or answer alleges a claim for equitable distribution.

JUSTIFICATION:
Discrepancies presently exist in the
different Judicial
Departments regarding the acceptance of notices of pendency for
filing matrimonial actions. In those areas where notices of pendency
are not accepted for filing in matrimonial actions, the non-title
holding spouse must take additional steps, such as seeking an
injunction restraining the conveyance of marital property. This
bill would make these additional and burdensome steps unnecessary,
and would make the practice of accepting notices of pendency for
filing uniform across the State.

FISCAL IMPLICATION:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect on the
thirtieth day after
it shall have become a law.
